results.title: Love of static sound
results.brief_description: A range of visual treatments including image within image and beat mixed editing creates a seductive and culturally revealing music video clip. Two characters are depicted using a high impact visual style with an underlying narrative.

results.title: Love of books
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “This Is Britain”.
Brief glimpses into the work of British printers and bookmakers. The film shows the reading room of the British Museum; Oliver, the calligraphist and illuminator; Caxton’s first Chaucer; the binding and print in some 18th century volumes; publishers; children’s books and much more.

results.title: Love now pay later
results.creator_credit: Pauline Shaw and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Facts Are These”.
An introductory description of the increasing incidence of venereal disease. A consultant surgeon of a London VD Clinic explains the range of causative factors.

results.title: Love my dog
results.creator_credit: Hal Roach, Hal Roach Studios and Robert F. McGowan
results.brief_description: Silent slapstick comedy featuring “Our Gang” and their efforts to prevent Farina’s beloved pooch being caught and put down by a dog-catcher. Cast includes Joe Cobb, Jackie Condon, Dick Gilbert, Allen “Farina” Hoskins, Scooter Lowry. Silent film with English captions.

results.title: Love me, love my dog
results.brief_description: In Great Britain each year 70,000 accidents and 3,000 human casualties are caused by dogs on the roads, and we see how Barbara Woodhouse and the Croxley Canine Training Society train dogs and their owners in road safety.

results.title: Love Me Do (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “All in the Mind Series”.
Examines the social psychology of relationships, considers how stable social relationships are vital to human beings and shows how social abilities greatly influence an individual’s health and happiness.

results.title: Love Letters from Teralba Road
results.creator_credit: Richard Brennan, Australian Film Commission and Stephen Wallace
results.brief_description: This excellent film was one of the first significant films of the revived Australian film industry to focus on working-class characters. It has a raw, painful and moving story, based on real love letters uncovered in a flat in Newcastle by director Stephen Wallace, and the first impressive screen performance from a young Bryan Brown. Cast also includes Kris McQuade, Gia Carides, Joy Hruby, Kevin Leslie, Ashe Venn. Photography by Tom Cowan, assistant photography by Martha Ansara.
